intro: Oxytropis alpicola, commonly known as the alpine oxytropis, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions. The plant features compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, pea-like flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. It is adapted to harsh mountain environments, with a deep root system to access water and nutrients in poor soils. Oxytropis alpicola plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various alpine organisms.
